laboratory_examinations.findings: The brain weighed 1,120 g; atrophy of the bilateral frontal and temporal lobes with parietal and occipital sparing. Hypertrophic astrogliosis within white matter; loss of axonal processes; prominent axonal spheroids; no inflammation; no tau, ubiquitin, or prion protein inclusions detected.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The subject developed progressive behavioral change (including wandering), disorientation, poor memory, decreased speaking, mutism, bowel and bladder incontinence, hypertonia, myoclonic jerks, and gait abnormalities over a period from 1995 to 2001.

laboratory_examinations.findings: The brain weighed 1,150 g; both frontal lobes atrophic; no infarctions; marked increase in glia cells; minimal neuron loss. No Alzheimer changes or histologic evidence of PD.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subject exhibited progressive movement and cognitive decline during his sixth decade before passing at age 59.

laboratory_examinations.findings: The brain weighed 1,150 g; frontal gyri mildly atrophic; ventricular dilation; marked micro-vacuolation indicating prominent neuronal loss with gliosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subject exhibited behavioral changes and dementia during her eighth decade.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Fatal findings at age 66 included severe frontal atrophy and diffuse white matter degenerative changes.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive behavioral and cognitive deficits noted from age 58 to 66.
Subject started on B12 and was referred to the University of Virginia; no mention of change over time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: MMSE score of 25/30; identified deficits in memory and cognition.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decline in cognitive abilities as noted in follow-up assessments.

laboratory_examinations.findings: MRI showed diffuse mild atrophy and periventricular white matter disease.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition progressed over a year until subjects death.

laboratory_examinations.findings: MDRS score of 130/144; mild cognitive impairment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Minor decline noted in repeat neuropsychological testing, with family noting further deterioration.
